N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 621.7 - Requirements for a Housing Finance Agency mortgage loan

State Regulations
(a) An applicant may apply for an HFA
mortgage loan, for State aid or for both. (b) A completed application must be submitted
to the commissioner in the format and on forms prescribed by the
commissioner. (c) A certification
of need application pursuant to the commissioner's regulations must be
completed and approved prior to the payment of HFA mortgage loan
funds. (d) When applying for an HFA
mortgage loan, the applicant shall prepare and submit a certificate of
incorporation in a form satisfactory to the commissioner for the corporation to
be formed which will acquire the site and construct the facility and receive
the mortgage loan. (e) The
applicant for an HFA mortgage loan must have or will have, at the time the HFA
mortgage is executed and delivered, a fee simple including necessary easements
and rights-of-way free and clear of all covenants, restrictions, mortgages, easements and encumbrances, sufficient to assure undisturbed use and possession
for the purpose of the facility except that the facility may be subject to the

New York State Housing Finance Agency mortgage to be obtained pursuant to
article 75 of the Mental Hygiene Law. (f) All applicants receiving an HFA mortgage
loan are required to establish and maintain accounting and fiscal records in a
manner approved by the commissioner to reflect the receipt and expenditure of
funds allotted and paid for capital costs. Similar suitable accounts shall be
maintained to show receipt and disbursement of Federal, local or other finds
used for matching purposes. (g) The
commissioner and the HFA shall have access to the books, records and physical
site of any facility receiving an HFA mortgage loan. Notes
